data.title: Obituaries: Lucien Freud, Artist Born: December 8, 1922. Died: July 20, 2011, aged: 88
data.meta_description: LUCIAN Freud was one of the most outstanding artists of his generation.
data.text:
i=b9468c6c083bfe4f2dbaa0f73609a125ba315cb5&itnvideo=0992fbaa4ca5489fadcea0463bf86372&width=468&height=400&endplaylist=true&autoplay=true

The grandson of Sigmund Freud and estranged brother of Clement, the Liberal MP who died two years ago, Freud was a difficult man with a convoluted personal life, an unknown number of children (rumoured to be 40) and a style of painting which, with its psychological overtones, was influenced by his grandfatherâ€™s work.

He had viewed the horrors of war close up, with the result that his paintings were not always easy viewing and rarely flattered the sitter.

Even Jerry Hall and Kate Moss, two of his numerous models, did not look beautiful in paint.

Lucian Freud was born in Berlin, two years before Clement. In 1933 when he was 11, the family moved to London to escape the growing Nazi threat. He attended Dartington School and then Bryanston before going to the Central School of Art.

He went on to the East Anglian School of Painting and Drawing before becoming a merchant seaman.

Lucian Freud was one of the most outstanding artists of his generation
